summary: The Baltic Security Initiative Act proposes to strengthen the defense capabilities of Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania. The bill authorizes the Secretary of Defense to establish an initiative promoting security cooperation with these Baltic countries to deter Russian aggression, enhance regional military planning, and improve cyber defenses. It outlines specific objectives, including investments in long-range precision fire systems, air defense, and land forces development. The bill authorizes $350 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2028 and encourages matching funds from the Baltic countries.
